thread.title: Argentina side River Plate somehow miss glorious four-on-one chance - goalkeeper also makes stunning save
thread.title_full: Argentina side River Plate somehow miss glorious four-on-one chance - goalkeeper also makes stunning save

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Argentina side River Plate somehow miss glorious four-on-one chance - goalkeeper also makes stunning save
text:
On Sunday night, River Plate produced, quite arguably, the miss of the century. 
The Argentinian top tier side, who sit sixth in the league, were hosting second from bottom team Belgrano. 
With the home side leading 2-1, Belgrano were pushing forward in the sixth minute of injury time for a precious equaliser. 
However, the away side's move broke down due to a poor pass and gave River Plate the chance to break. 
After beating one player, River Plate were four on one with the goalkeeper. It's literally impossible to miss from here (Photo: ASTV) 
Unselfishly, the fella who did all the hard work squares the ball past Lucas Acosta (Belgrano's keeper) to his teammate. 
Tomas Andrade, who came on eight minutes prior, only needs to tap the ball into the back of the net. How did this happen? (Photo: ASTV) 
However, the Argentine midfielder softly side-foots the ball towards goal giving the goalkeeper a slim chance of saving it. 
Acosta doesn't waste his opportunity and somehow races back to brilliantly clear the ball off the line.
